misuses.misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
misuses.description: Blowfish is a broken encryption algorithm that has been shown to be vulnerable to a variety of attacks. It should not be used for any purpose.
misuses.recommendation: Replace Blowfish with a secure encryption algorithm, such as AES.

misuses.misuse: CWE-757: Selection of Less-Secure Algorithm During Negotiation
misuses.description: The encryption algorithm used is determined by the passedAlgo variable, which is not verified or validated. This could allow an attacker to specify a weak or broken encryption algorithm, which could be exploited.
misuses.recommendation: Validate the passedAlgo variable to ensure it is a valid and secure encryption algorithm.
